description.narrative: Ce projet vise la conservation du paysage hydro forestier du Lac Télé en République du Congo et du Lac Tumba en République Démocratique du Congo
first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Ce projet vise à assurer la catalisation de la gestion durable des forêts sur le site des zones humides transfrontalières des lacs Télé et Tumba.

description.narrative: third-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Ce projet vise à assurer la catalisation de la gestion durable des forêts sur le site des zones humides transfrontalières des lacs Télé et Tumba.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: A regional strategy and policy framework for transboundary cooperation on a representative network of PAs in the LTLT swamp forest landscape is developed adopted and implemented
Legally established protected areas area with of the overall landscape

comment.narrative: 1188700 ha 93 of the landscape
2100000 ha 167 of the landscape

The project is still at the baseline level because it has not yet started its activities The reasons are
There was delay in the recruitment of the Project Management Unit staff as a result of the misunderstandings with regards to the implementing Partner of the project as the DRC Government wanted to implement the project instead of the WWF as stated in the PRODOC
However the projects main actors kept meeting This dialogue resulted in the confirmation of WWF and WCS as the project implementing partners Since July 2015 a Steering Committee is set up it has met twice between in July and August 2015
A coordinator was also hired The Annual work plan for the last quarter 2015 ie October to December was signed by representatives of both governments the ratification of the work plan by WWF and WCS is in progress Project activities will therefore start and the first results are expected at the end of 2015

description.narrative: Adapted community capacity scorecard

comment.narrative: Community capacity not currently assessed to be assessed by end of yr 1
Targets for 2014 set in Yr 1 after assessment

The project is still at the baseline level because it has not yet started its activities The reasons are
There is no management staff
There are some misunderstandings as the DRC Government to implement the projects instead of WWF as it is stated in the PRODOC
However the projects main actors kept meeting This dialogue resulted in the confirmation of WWF and WCS as the project implemented partners Since July 2015 a Steering Committee has been set up it has met twice between the months of July and August 2015
A coordinator was also hired The work plans for the last trimester of 2015 ie October to December is signed by representatives of both governments the ratification of the work plan by WWF and WCS is in progress Project activities will therefore start and the first results are expected at the end of 2015

description.narrative: Protocol on transboundary cooperation for the conservation of the LTLT Landscape

comment.narrative: Draft protocol exists
Transboundary protocol signed

A cooperation agreement between the governments of the Republic of Congo and the DRC on the binational Lake TéléLake Tumba was signed in August 2010 But the project is still at the baseline level because it has not yet started its activities The reasons are
There was delay in the recruitment of the Project Management Unit staff as a result of the misunderstandings with regards to the implementing Partner of the project as the DRC Government wanted to implement the project instead of the WWF as stated in the PRODOC
However the projects main actors kept meeting This dialogue resulted in the confirmation of WWF and WCS as the project implementing partners Since July 2015 a Steering Committee is set up it has met twice between in July and August 2015
A coordinator was also hired The Annual work plan for the last quarter 2015 ie October to December was signed by representatives of both governments the ratification of the work plan by WWF and WCS is in progress Project activities will therefore start and the first results are expected at the end of 2015
Transboundary protocol signed

description.narrative: Legislationdecrees on comanagement that refer to the protocol and strategy from above

comment.narrative: Laws exist for natural resource management which vaguely allude to community roles

Application decrees drafted and submitted to the governments which allow for delegated andor subcontracted natural resource and protected area management to nonstate actors including local communities as described in the protocol and strategy

description.narrative: Alternative livelihood program including sustainable use of natural resources for conservationcompatible targets

comment.narrative: No livelihood targets and no program

25 of people in and around PAs and two lakes engaged in sustainable natural resource use schemes and starting to benefit from pilot alternative livelihoods as measured by progress towards conservationcompatible targets

description.narrative: The project goal in the Lac TeleLac Tumba Landscape is an expanded system of protected areas which are managed effectively adaptively and collaboratively through partnerships that include government and nongovernment actors and local communities The protected areas shall allow for sustainable use of natural resources while at the same time optimizing ecological service functions particularly carbonsink and storage and water storage and flowcontrol

Coverage of protected areas in the Lac TeleLac Tumba Landscape
As the project didnot really start because of conflict in the RC and DRC actors schedule we couldnot edit indicators

However the projects main actors kept meeting This dialogue resulted in the confirmation of WWF and WCS as the project implementing partners Since July 2015 a Steering Committee is set up it has met twice between in July and August 2015
A coordinator was also hired The Annual work plan for the last quarter 2015 ie October to December was signed by representatives of both governments the ratification of the work plan by WWF and WCS is in progress Project activities will therefore start and the first results are expected at the end of 2015

description.narrative: 1- Pourcentage des responsables des aires protégées ayant des compétences pour la conservation de la biodiversité 2- Existence d'un mécanisme d'appui aux moyens de subsistance pour une utilisation durable des ressources naturelles 3- Existence d'un accord transfrontalier entre les 2 Congo pour la gestion d’écosystème du paysage lac Télé-lac Tumba 4- Document du plan d’aménagement de la RCLT annexant la Bailly et Batanga 5- Procès-verbaux de réunion du CBPE et CBSA 6- Disponibilité du rapport d’évaluation de l’efficacité de gestion de la RNTN disponible 7- Existence du document du plan de gestion de la RTL (Reserve Tumba-Lediima); 8- Nombre de communautés locales de développement formé et appuyé 9- Existence du document de faisabilité de projet carbone 10- Rapport de formation 11- Protocole d'entente entre les communautés de la RTL, ICCN et WWF 12- Pourcentage d'opérationnalisation des équipes de lutte anti braconnage

comment.narrative: 1- Faibles compétences des responsables des aires protégées pour les fonctions de conservation; 2- Absence d'un mécanisme d'appui aux moyens de subsistance pour une utilisation durable des ressources naturelles. 3- Inexistence d'un accord transfrontalier entre les 2 Congo pour la gestion d’écosystème du paysage lac Télé-lac Tumba 4- Des lois existent pour la gestion des ressources naturelles qui vaguement font allusion au rôle des communautés 5- 3 sites Ramsar contigus 6- 1.188.700 ha. (9,3% du paysage total) 7- Les institutions issues du protocole sur la binational LTLT sont mises en place mais pas opérationnelles 8- Efficacité de gestion de la RNTN non évaluée 9- Pas de plan de gestion de la RTL 10- Capacité communautaire non évaluée actuellement 11- Pas de projet carbone 12- Capacités moyennes des responsables des AP en gestion participative et gestion des conflits 13- Conflit latent entre communautés locales et ICCN dans la RTL 14- Faible capacité de l’ICCN et de l’ACFAP dans la surveillance des marchés transfrontaliers de viande de brousse (37%)
